required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bad Breath Response to Tongue Scraper and Rinses
clinical_study.official_title: Bad Breath Response to Tongue Scraper and Rinses, a Double-blind, Randomized, Parallel Group Clinical Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: Medical center personnel were screened organoleptically for bad breath by 2 investigators using Rosenberg scale 0-5, and measurement of breath sample in portable gas chromatograph. With a threshold score of 2 or more, or 75parts per billion(ppb) hydrogen sulfide(H2S), subjects invited to enter clinical trial of the mechanical effect of daily tongue scraping with the adjunctive use of 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash or 0.1% stabilized chlorine dioxide mouthwash. Subjects randomly assigned in double-blind trial for one week. The null hypothesis is there will be no difference between the two rinses as adjuncts to tongue scraping.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects in trial had oral and periodontal exam and scored the Ramfjord teeth(#3, 9, 12, 19, 25, 28) for Plaque Index(PlI), Gingival Index(GI), probing depth (PD), recession. A tongue coating index is scored and sample of coating on dorsum taken for culture of total viable count and percentage of black sulfide-producing colonies on anaerobe agar with lead acetate added. Subjects given hygiene instruction and instruction on use of scraper, then rinse with 20ml assigned mouthwash 30sec. Breath assessed by organoleptic means and mouth air sample concentration of hydrogen sulfide, methyl mercaptan in portable gas chromatograph at 0, 1, 2, and 4 hours. Subjects use scraper and mouthwash twice daily for one week and return for final exam.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Rosenberg Score at Indicated Time Points
primary_outcome.description: 2 investigators are trained to evaluate smell using the Rosenberg scale which measures foul smelling breath. The Rosenberg scale is validated and is scored 0-5 with 0= no bad breath, 5=worst bad breath. A score of 2 is the threshold at which bad breath is determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concentration of Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) in Mouth Air at 1 Hour
Concentration of Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) in Mouth Air at 2 Hours
Concentration of Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) in Mouth Air at 4 Hours
Concentration of Hydrogen Sulfide (H2S) in Mouth Air at 1 Week
Concentration of Methyl Mercaptan (MM) in Mouth Air at 1 Hour
Concentration of Methyl Mercaptan (MM) in Mouth Air at 2 Hours
Concentration of Methyl Mercaptan (MM) in Mouth Air at 4 Hours
Concentration of Methyl Mercaptan (MM) in Mouth Air at 1 Week
Number of Bacteria on Tongue at 1 Week
secondary_outcome.description: Total viable count(TVC) in colony forming units(CFU) on anaerobe agar

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Sulfide-producing Black Colonies Out of Total Viable Count(TVC) on Anaerobe Agar Containing Lead Acetate

arm_group.description: The intervention was accomplished by subject after instructions from investigator: twice a day a tongue scraper was used with 4 or more strokes, followed by 20ml of 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate mouthwash used for 30 sec, for one week.

The intervention was accomplished by subject after instructions by investigator: twice a day the scraper was used for 4 strokes then 20ml 0.1% stabilized chlor8ine dioxide rinse for 30sec, for one week.

intervention.description: 20ml of mouthwash used for 30sec as adjunct to tongue scraper twice a day
The intervention was accomplished by subject after instructions by investigator: twice a day the scraper was used for 4 strokes then 20ml 0.12% chlorhexidine gluconate rinse for 30sec, for one week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult with threshold score of 2 on organoleptic halitosis evaluation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Taking another experimental drug, or antibiotic.

results_reference.citation: Wirthlin MR, Im T, Ellis RR, Hoover CI. Effect of tongue scraper and rinses on bad breath, a double-blind, randomized, parallel group clinical trial. J West Soc Periodontol Periodontal Abstr. 2011;59(3):67-73.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Screening in dental clinic March 2008-March 2009. With organoleptic(OLT)score of 2 or more, or 75parts per billion(ppb) hydrogen sulfide(H2S), subjects invited to enter clinical trial. Subjects numbered in sequence from a computer-generated table of random numbers.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Exclusions: 1)Inability to return for evaluation, 2)inability to follow directions, 3) afflicted with systemic disease involving volatile sulfur compounds (VSC), 4)currently taking antibiotics, 5) using medicine in syrup form, 6) advanced periodontal disease, 7) smoker.

measure.title: Percentage of Sulfide-producing Black Colonies Out of Total Viable Count(TVC) on Anaerobe Agar Containing Lead Acetate

analysis.groups_desc: Percentage of black colonies out of Total Viable Count cultured on anaerobe agar with lead acetate. Black colonies are those producing sulfides (H2S, MM)and creating black lead sulfide. Analyzed between groups. Groups compared at baseline and 1 week.

group.title: Chlorine Dioxide Rinse and Tongue Scraper

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Total number of subjects is less than the desired 50 persons; dimethyl sulfide measures distorted by materials in syringes; accuracy of portable gas chromatograph a concern.

point_of_contact.organization: Department of Orofacial Sciences, University of California, San Francisco
